column2: (opens the door wearing a robe, but leaves the chain on) Hey,\nwhat\xc2\x92s up?'
Well, I left my guitar here again.'
Oh, okay. No problem.'
Okay. (Monica closes the door, gets the guitar, and then hands it out.)'
Okay.'
Oh.'
Here you go.'
Okay. '
Okay.'
Great! Umm\xc2\x85(Monica closes the door again and Phoebe knocks again.)'
What?!'
So do you want to hang out or something?'
Phoebe! You kinda caught me at a bad time.'
Oh are you and Chandler\xc2\x85'
Yes! Exactly.'
Okay. Do you guys want me to play for you?'
(laughs) No. (Closes the door as Chandler walks up.)'
Hey Pheebs, what\xc2\x92s up?'
You ask an intriguing question Chandler Bing.'
Oh my God! You\xc2\x92re getting a massage! You never let me massage you!!'
Phoebe, I can explain!'
You told me you hate massages!'
Buy stamps, pick up dry cleaning\xc2\x85Don\xc2\x92t let Phoebe in.'
I can\xc2\x92t believe this! How long as this been going on?'
Well umm, Alexandra has been\xc2\x85'
Oh, it has a name?'
Phoebe, don\xc2\x92t get upset!'
Okay\xc2\x97Oop! Too late! I\xc2\x92m leaving! Come on Chandler let\xc2\x92s\ngo! (She storms out.)'
Well, Phoebe I thought I\xc2\x92d\xc2\x97(Off Phoebe\xc2\x92s\nlook)\xc2\x97Yeah, what the hell. (Exits with Phoebe.)'
Oh okay, okay! One more push! One more push! Come on honey, we\xc2\x92re\nalmost there! We\xc2\x92re almost there!'
Oh Joey, I\xc2\x92m so happy things worked out for us that we\xc2\x92re\nhaving this baby together. I love you so much.'
Oh, I love you too.'
And I hope it\xc2\x92s not an inappropriate time to say this but,\nyou\xc2\x92re the best sex I ever had.'
That\xc2\x92s always appropriate! (Back to the matter at hand) Oh, okay. One\nmore push! One more push!'
Oh, here is your beautiful baby. Congratulations! '
(crying) I hope you\xc2\x92re a better father than you\xc2\x92re a friend!!\n(Cries again and Joey wakes up in horror.)'
(bursts into the room) Joey! Joey!'
What? What\xc2\x92s going on?'
Come feel this! Come feel my belly!'
Aaaah\xc2\x85'
Joey! The baby is kicking for the first time! Will you please come feel\nthis?!'
Really?!'
Yes!'
Oh, y\xc2\x92know what? Maybe uh, you\xc2\x85you should come to me. I\xc2\x92m a\nnot, I\xc2\x92m not wearing any bottoms.'
Oh, okay! (She goes over to him and he feels her belly.)'
Oh my, oh my God!'
Aw, it\xc2\x92s unbelievable! Wow! She is kicking so much! Oh, she\xc2\x92s\nlike umm\xc2\x85oh\xc2\x85who\xc2\x92s that kind of annoying girl soccer player?'
Mia Hamm?'
Mia Hamm!'
Oh that\xc2\x92s amazing. (Drops the sheet.)'
(looking down) Oh-oh!! One hand on the sheet Joe!'
Whoa-hey-oh! Sorry!'
Hey babe.'
Hi honey. We just got a wedding gift from Bob and Faye Bing; they\ndon\xc2\x92t like us do they? (They gave them a pok-a-dotted punch bowl.)'
Who says you can\xc2\x92t get a nice punch bowl for under six bucks?\nMaybe we can take it back?'
No, it doesn\xc2\x92t say where it came from. Where would we return it?'
How about to the street say from the balcony?'
Why don\xc2\x92t we just find a place for it?'
Okay. How about in that cabinet?'
No! That\xc2\x92s where we keep the canned goods! Have you completely\nforgotten everything you learned at orientation?'
How about the closet by the bathroom? (The secret green door by the\nbathroom.)'
Oh, okay. Here, why don\xc2\x92t you let me do it?'

Oh no-no-no, I will do it. Honey, you have to learn to sit down and\nrelax and let your husband take care of things once and awhile. (Tries the door.)\nIt\xc2\x92s locked, you have to help me. Why is it locked?'
No reason. I-I keep private things in there.'
Oh y\xc2\x92know, I\xc2\x92ve been living here a while and I\xc2\x92ve never\nseen what\xc2\x92s inside that closet. What is, what is in there?'
Feminine stuff.'
Don\xc2\x92t try to make me uncomfortable with feminine stuff!'
Chandler, there is nothing in there that concerns you! If you love me\nyou-you\xc2\x92ll let it go.'
Fine.'
Thank you! (He tries the door again and Monica glares at him.)'
(walking casually away) Love you.'
(entering) Hello Chandler, lovely day huh? (To Monica) You!'
Phoebe if it helps Alexandra has only been massaging Monica for like\nthree years. (Phoebe rolls her eyes and walks away and Monica glares at him.) If! I said,\n"If it helps!" (Goes to the bedroom.)'
Why won\xc2\x92t you let me massage you?'
Well it\xc2\x92s\xc2\x85I mean I\xc2\x92d just\xc2\x97I\xc2\x92d be\nself-conscious. You\xc2\x92re my friend; I\xc2\x92d be naked.'
Monica! We lived together for years! I\xc2\x92ve seen you naked!'
That\xc2\x92s different, we were roommates! And when?!'
I\xc2\x92m curious about the human body.'
Hey, come on Phoebe, you can understand why this would be weird for me.'
But I\xc2\x92m a professional! And I\xc2\x92m really good! Look, if\nyou\xc2\x92re uncomfortable we can stop. Just give me a chance, okay. Please?'
Okay, if it means that much to you\xc2\x85'
It does! How would you feel if you couldn\xc2\x92t share your cooking?\nOr-or imagine how Ross would feel if he couldn\xc2\x92t teach us about dragons.'
Dinosaurs.'
Potato, potaato. '
Hey!'
Hey Ross! The baby\xc2\x92s kicking!'
What?! It is?! (He tries to quickly remove his gloves, but runs into\ntrouble and finally throws them off of his hands like a hockey player in a fight and grabs\nRachel\xc2\x92s belly.)'
It\xc2\x92s not kicking right now. Although we would love to see you do\n(Mimics him) that again.'
Hey, when-when was it kicking? What happened?'
Last night! I just felt it and I went into Joey\xc2\x92s room and he was\nsleeping\xc2\x85'
A dreamless sleep.'
My God, the baby\xc2\x92s kicking. That\xc2\x92s great. Although I\xc2\x85kinda\nwish I-I would\xc2\x92ve been there to feel the kicking for the first time y\xc2\x92know.'
Well I got stuff going on in here (Rubbing his belly) if you wanna feel.'

Look, I-I don\xc2\x92t want to miss anymore baby stuff. So\xc2\x85Here.
Here\xc2\x92s my new pager number, okay? Anytime anything pregnancy related happens use it!
I\xc2\x92ll be there! Okay? I don\xc2\x92t care if it\xc2\x92s three in the morning and all you
want is ice cream.'
Wow! Can I get a copy of that?'
(calling from her room) Are you under the sheet?'
Yes. '
(in a soothing voice) Great, let\xc2\x92s begin. (She starts the massage.)\nHow\xc2\x92s the pressure?'
Nice! Wow Phoebe you are good!'
Stating the obvious, but thank you. And it\xc2\x92s not weird is it.'
No. Ooohh\xc2\x85'
That\xc2\x92s right, you just enjoy.'
(in a sexy voice) Oh. Oh yeah! Ohhhhh! Ohh! Oh yeah! '
(getting uncomfortable) Okay.'

Oh God Phoebe!! (Phoebe covers one ear.) Oh that\xc2\x92s it! That\xc2\x92s\nit! Right there! Oh! (Tries to cover the other ear.) Ooooh-oooh-ooooh\xc2\x85 (Covers both\nears and continues the massage with her elbows.)'
I wasn\xc2\x92t trying to open your closet! I wasn\xc2\x92t trying to open\nyour closet! I swear! (Running into the kitchen and sees its Joey.)'
Whoa, Monica runs a pretty tight ship over here. What are you doing?'
Monica has a secret closet and she won\xc2\x92t let me see what\xc2\x92s\nin it.'
Why not?'
I don\xc2\x92t know! What could she possibly be hiding in here that I\ncan\xc2\x92t see?!'
I don\xc2\x92t know. Ooh, I bet it\xc2\x92s Richard.'
Why would Monica be keeping Richard in here?'
Well off the top of my head uhh, maybe she\xc2\x92s having her cake and\neating it too. You being the cake and Richard being the too. Or!'
And here we go\xc2\x85'

I saw this movie once where there was a door and no one knew what was
behind it, and when they finally got it open millions and millions and millions of bugs
came pouring out and they feasted on human flesh. Y\xc2\x92know it wouldn\xc2\x92t kill ya to
respect your wife\xc2\x92s privacy! (He walks away and into his apartment and looks the
door.) Stupid closet full of bugs!'
Joey. Joey, something feels weird and not good weird. I\ndon\xc2\x92t\xc2\x97Whoa!! (Winces in pain.)'
Oh hey whoa-whoa, don\xc2\x92t worry. Okay. When my sisters were pregnant\nthey got every weird feeling in the book, it was always nothing.'
Really?'
Absolutely. But, we\xc2\x92re gonna stop by the hospital just to be\nsure, okay? I\xc2\x92ll page Ross on the way. Come on.'
Okay. Oh God\xc2\x97Ow!\xc2\x97Oo!'
Okay Rach-Rach-Rach look at me, look at me, everything\xc2\x92s gonna be\nfine, trust me. Okay. Take my hand. Here we go. (Rachel grabs his hand.) Oww crushing\nbones!'
Hey! So?'
She\xc2\x92s fine. She\xc2\x92s experiencing Braxton-Hicks contractions,\nmild discomfort caused by contractions in the uterine wall.'
Hmm, mild discomfort. So I take it you\xc2\x92ve had one of these Braxton\nthingies?'
So but everything is normal.'
Absolutely.'
And-and there\xc2\x92s no danger to her and the baby?'
No-no. Contractions can be unnerving if you don\xc2\x92t know what they\nare, but she\xc2\x92s fine.'
Thank you doctor. (Dr. Long exits.) (To Joey) Oh thank you for being so\nnice and calm.'
Calm?! I wasn\xc2\x92t calm! I\xc2\x92ve never been more scared in all my\nlife!'
But wait you said everything was gonna be okay.'
Well what do I know?! I\xc2\x92m not a doctor!'
But I\xc2\x97But everything is okay. I\xc2\x92m fine!'
You sure?!'
Yes! Yes! I got half a mind to contract that doctor\xc2\x92s uterus\nthough. Mild discomfort, what\xc2\x92s he talking about?'
(seeing Ross) Oh hey-hey!'
(rushes in) Is everything okay?'
Yeah, everything\xc2\x92s fine!'
Your page said come to the hospital, what? What was it? What happened?'
Something called Braxton-Hicks contractions.'
Oh. Oh. Thank God, most women don\xc2\x92t even feel them.'
Okay, no uterus, no opinion.'
Hey uh, what\xc2\x92s with the candy?'
Oh when you beeped me I was on line at the concession stand at the movie\ntheater.'
Oh you went to the movies by yourself?'
No I\xc2\x97Mona!'
Oh, I gotta go back in there.'
What? Why? What\xc2\x92s wrong?'
No, everything\xc2\x92s fine. I just gotta go back\xc2\x85'
No really, you tell me what\xc2\x92s up.'
I-I forgot my underwear. (Ross lets her go.)'
(To Joey) So, thanks so much for bringing her to the hospital.'
Oh hey, don\xc2\x92t worry about it man. Don\xc2\x92t worry about it, no big\ndeal.'
Yeah but still, I mean it should\xc2\x92ve been me. I\xc2\x92m the dad.'

(To Joey) Uh, if you have any questions, here\xc2\x92s some information\non Braxton-Hicks. (Hands Joey a pamphlet.) Oh and by the way, you did the right thing by\nbringing her in. You\xc2\x92re gonna make a wonderful father.'
Oh uh, hey. Not as good as this guy! (Grabs Ross around the shoulders.) He\nbrought Twizlers!'
There has got to be a way!'
Easy there Captain Kirk. Oh, do you have a bobby pin?'
Yeah. (Checks his hair.) Oh no wait, I\xc2\x92m not an nine-year-old\ngirl.'
Then why do you throw like one?'
Maybe Monica has a bobby pin.'
Sure. "Monica."'
So, how\xc2\x92s the hideously inappropriate crush on Rachel coming?'

Uh, really good. Really good. Yeah, I should be ready to kill myself any
day now. (Chandler returns with a bobby pin and hands it to Joey.) Wow, you sure found
that quick. (He tries the pin in the lock.) I just\xc2\x97I wish I didn\xc2\x92t feel this way
about Rachel anymore, y\xc2\x92know? I wish things could go back to normal. I mean, I love
living with her and God, helping out with the baby is just amazing, but now I think\xc2\x85I
think Ross feels left out. Y\xc2\x92know? When I had to take Rachel to the hospital, the
doctor thought I was the father. God\xc2\x85 You should\xc2\x92ve seen the look on Ross\xc2\x92s
face. (Pause) By the way, I have no idea what I\xc2\x92m doing here. For all I know I\xc2\x92m
just locking it more. Oh hey, did you try opening it with a credit card?'
That\xc2\x92s a good idea.'
Yeah.'
Okay. (They switch places and Chandler gets out a credit card.) So uh,\nRoss is kinda bummed huh?'
Oh, I just\xc2\x85I feel terrible.'

Well, it\xc2\x92s not your fault. What are you gonna do? Not take her to
the hospital? Y\xc2\x92know? You\xc2\x92re doing nothing wrong. (Pause) Except for harboring
an all consuming love for the woman whose carrying his baby. (He loses his card behind the
door.) Richard? If-if you\xc2\x92re in there, could you pass me my credit card?'
Hey.'
Hey.'
I gotta tell you, yesterday was amazing. That massage felt so good!'
No-no, I got that.'
So umm, what do you say we make it a weekly appointment?'
Okay. Okay but you should know though, I\xc2\x92ve raised my rates to $200\nan hour.'
Okay.'
I mean $500.'
What?'
What\xc2\x92s going on?'
Oh, you make sex noises when you get massaged!'
What? (Laughs.)'
Yeah, and it really freaked me out! And after a while I even tried to\nhurt you and it just spurred you on.'
What?! You\xc2\x92re crazy! There\xc2\x92s nothing sexual about the noises I\nmake!'
Really? There\xc2\x92s nothing sexual about this? (Sexily) Oooh. Oo God!\nOhh. Ohhhh. Ohh. (Some cute guy is watching closely.) (To him) What are you looking at?!\n(Pause) I mean hi.'
Oh my\xc2\x97This is so embarrassing. Oh my God, I\xc2\x92m never gonna get\nmassaged again!'
No, you can\xc2\x92t let this stop you from getting massages! No look, I\nhave, I have lots of clients that make the same noises you do!'
Really?!'
Well not clients, lovers. But let\xc2\x92s just y\xc2\x92know, try it again.\nCome back and-and we\xc2\x92ll work through it.'
Are you sure?'
Yes.'
I guess.'
Great! Okay, if you\xc2\x92ll just excuse me. (To the guy) So, did you\nhear something you liked?'
Hey Ross! Check it out! I learned a new trick!'
Hey uh, I brought you some lunch.'
Ohh! That\xc2\x92s so sweet of you! Oh yum! (Takes a bite out of the\nsandwich and starts to get sick.) Did you put pickles on this?'
Well yeah!'
Oh Ross!! (Runs to the bathroom and closes the door.)'
What?! What?! Rach what?!'
What\xc2\x92s going on?'
I made her favorite, tuna salad with pickles.'
Pickle? Pickles make her sick. Giving her pickles is like giving me salad.'
(to Rachel) I-I\xc2\x92m sorry Rach, I didn\xc2\x92t know. Are you gonna be\nokay?'
Yeah, I\xc2\x92ll be fine. But could someone please make sure that\nsandwich is gone when I get out there?'
I\xc2\x92m on it! (Takes a bite out of the sandwich.)'
I can\xc2\x92t believe this! I shouldn\xc2\x92t be the one making her throw\nup!'
Dude relax! It could happen to anyone.'
Yeah? Not to you, because you know this stuff. I don\xc2\x92t know any of it\nand I\xc2\x92m the father. I wish I\xc2\x92d be more involved y\xc2\x92know.'
(entering) Well, if anyone is keeping score, I no longer eat tuna.'
Hey uh, can I, can I talk to you guys for a second?'
Yeah.'
What\xc2\x92s up?'
Uh, sit down. I wanna talk about our situation.'
(Gasps) Are you breaking up with us?'
The thing is\xc2\x85\xc2\x92cause I live with Rachel I\xc2\x92m here for a lot\nof the stuff, okay? (To Rachel) And Ross\xc2\x85Ross is missing everything. So\xc2\x85'
Yeah?'
Maybe you two should live together.'
Are you asking me to move out? Do you not want me here?'
Oh no-no, no-no I love living with you. It just seems that\xc2\x85if\nyou\xc2\x92re gonna have a roommate, y\xc2\x92know it might as well be the father.'
But Joey, I don\xc2\x92t think Ross wants me to move into his apartment\nand disrupt his life like that. I mean\xc2\x97(Ross turns to her with wishful eyes.)\xc2\x97Or\nhe does.'
No I-I-I would love to be around for you and the baby. And we-we can just\ntry it like on a temporary basis.'
But Ross, its you and me!'
So? Sure! But it-it wouldn\xc2\x92t be anything romantic. And\nI\xc2\x92m-I\xc2\x92m dating Mona\xc2\x97Damnit Mona! I was supposed to meet her like an hour\nago! What is wrong with me?!'
All right now, so? What do you think?'
I don\xc2\x92t know. Is it crazy?'
No! No it\xc2\x92s not. Joey, this is a smart idea.'
Well, I was due.'
Okay, let\xc2\x92s do it. I\xc2\x92ll move in.'
Really?'
Yeah.'
Oh Rach that\xc2\x92s great. That\xc2\x92s great. (They hug and Joey breathes\na sigh of relief.)'

Not to shabby, I got this all off myself\xc2\x85using my wife\xc2\x92s\ntools. (He takes the door off the frame and we finally get to see what\xc2\x92s behind the\ngreen door! It is stacked, floor to ceiling, with junk.) Oh my God!'
(entering) (Gasps) How did you get in there?!'
(laughs) You\xc2\x92re messy.'
Oh no! You weren\xc2\x92t supposed to see this!'
I married Fred Sanford!'

No Chandler, you don\xc2\x92t understand! (Chandler starts singing the\ntheme for Sanford and Son, an old TV show starring Redd Fox.) Okay! Okay! Okay!\nFine! Now you know. Okay? I\xc2\x92m y\xc2\x92know\xc2\x85I\xc2\x92m sick.'
No, honey you\xc2\x92re not sick! Look, I don\xc2\x92t love you because\nyou\xc2\x92re organized, I love you in spite of that.'
Really? You promise you won\xc2\x92t tell anyone?'
Yes! And look, now that I know if I got some extra stuff lying around\ncan we, can we share the closet.'
Well\xc2\x85it\xc2\x92s just umm\xc2\x85I\xc2\x92m afraid you might mess it up.'
Hey.'
Hey.'
So Rachel\xc2\x92s all moved out huh? How are you taking it?'

Well uh, I wanted to have a few beers, but uh, I got rid of those because
Rachel couldn\xc2\x92t stand the smell of them. But I have thrown back a lot of orange juice
with calcium though. And uh, it\xc2\x92s a couple weeks past it\xc2\x92s expiration date, so
it\xc2\x92s got a bit of a kick.'
Are you okay?'

Are you kidding me? I\xc2\x92m great! Yeah, I\xc2\x92m uh; I\xc2\x92m better
than great. I am good. And now that she\xc2\x92s gone, I can uh, I can do all this stuff
around here that I couldn\xc2\x92t do before. Y\xc2\x92know? Like umm, I can walk around naked
again. Y\xc2\x92know? I can uh, I can watch porn in the living room. Right? This is uh, this
is good for me. Y\xc2\x92know? I like being on my own, I\xc2\x92m uh, better off this way.
I\xc2\x92m uh, a lone wolf. Y\xc2\x92know? A loner. Alone. All alone. Forever. What\xc2\x92s a
wolf got to do to get a huh around here?! (Chandler rushes over and hugs him.)'
Ohhh.'
That\xc2\x92s it. Just relax.'
Ohh. Oh! Ohh!'
Come on more!'
Oh God!'
Yeah, you like that don\xc2\x92t you?'
Oh yeah right there!'
You want it there? You take it there baby!'
Uh Phoebe?'
Yeah, say my name. Say it! (She stops when she realizes what she\xc2\x92s\ndoing.) And now I\xc2\x92m going to cover you back up, and umm we\xc2\x92re never doing this\nagain.'
